newsitem.title: JAPAN: Mitsui Petchem to shut naphtha cracker from July 4.
newsitem.headline: Mitsui Petchem to shut naphtha cracker from July 4.

text.p: Mitsui Petrochemical Industries Ltd said on Tuesday that it would close a naphtha cracker at its Chiba plant, near Tokyo, from July 4 for regular maintenance checks.
The unit, which has an annual ethylene output capacity of 553,000 tonnes, will resume operations on August 5, a company spokesman said.

It would be the last routine maintenance closure at the plant before the firm merges with Mitsui Toatsu Chemicals Inc on October 1 to become Mitsui Chemicals Inc, creating Japan's second-largest chemical producer after Mitsubishi Chemical Corp, he added.
